name: schedule

operation.description: The type of operation the scheduler performs when executing this task.

hidden.description: if set to true the scheduled task is not displayed in the Railo Administrator.

requesttimeout.description:
Customizes the requestTimeOut for the task operation. Can be used to extend the default timeout
		for operations that require more time to execute.

proxyuser.description: User name to provide to the proxy server.

serverpassword.description: allow you to access filesystem, also when access is denied for your context

url.description: Required when action = 'update'. The URL to be executed.

endtime.description: The time when the scheduled task ends. Enter a value in seconds.

file.description: Required with publish ='Yes' A valid filename for the published file.

publish.description: Specifies whether the result should be saved to a file.

task.description: The name of the task to delete, update, or run.

returnvariable.description: return variable name of action list

starttime.description:
Required when creating tasks with action = 'update'. Enter a value in seconds. The time when
	scheduling of the task starts.

proxyport.description:
The port number on the proxy server from which the task is being requested. Default is 80. When
		used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically
		resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

proxypassword.description: Password to provide to the proxy server.

enddate.description: The date when the scheduled task ends.

interval.description:
Required when creating tasks with action = 'update'. Interval at which task should be scheduled.
		Can be set in seconds or as Once, Daily, Weekly, and Monthly. The default interval is one hour. The
		minimum interval is one minute.

startdate.description: Required when action ='update'. The date when scheduling of the task should start.

path.description: Required with publish ='Yes' The path location for the published file.

proxyserver.description: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

paused.description: if set to true the scheduled task is paused.

port.description:
The port number on the server from which the task is being scheduled. Default is 80. When used
		with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved
		to preserve links in the retrieved document.

action.description:
- delete: deletes the specified task
- update: updates an existing task or creates a new task, if one with the name specified by the task attribute does not exist
- run: executes the specified task
- list: list all scheduled tasks defined
- pause: pause execution of the defined scheduled task
- resume: resume execution of a paused scheduled task

readonly.description: if set to true the scheduled task can not be modified or deleted in the Railo Administrator.

autodelete.description: if set to true, the scheduled task get deleted when there is no possible future execution.

resolveurl.description: Specifies whether to resolve links in the result page to absolute references.

description:
Provides a programmatic interface to the scheduling engine. You can run a specified
  page at scheduled intervals with the option to write out static HTML pages. This lets you offer users
  access to pages that publish data, such as reports, without forcing users to wait while a database transaction
  is performed in order to populate the data on the page.
